types.name: EnvVar
types.description:
An environment variable.

Accessible via: "$key". "Key" name must follows the POSIX specifications (alphanumeric with underscore).

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: HTTPData
types.description: HTTPData describes the necessary variables to connect to a HTTP storage.

types.name: S3Data
types.description: S3Data describes the necessary variables to connect to a S3 storage.

inputFields.name: region
inputFields.description: S3 region. Example: "us‑east‑2".

inputFields.name: bucketUrl
inputFields.description:
The S3 Bucket URL. Must not end with "/".

Example: "s3://my-bucket".

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: The absolute path to a directory/file inside the bucket. Must start with "/".

inputFields.name: accessKeyId
inputFields.description: An access key ID for the S3 endpoint.

inputFields.name: secretAccessKey
inputFields.description: A secret access key for the S3 endpoint.

inputFields.name: endpointUrl
inputFields.description: A S3 Endpoint URL used for authentication. Example: https://s3.us‑east‑2.amazonaws.com

inputFields.name: deleteSync
inputFields.description:
DeleteSync removes destination files that doesn't correspond to the source.

This applies to any type of source to any type of destination (s3 or filesystem).

See: s5cmd sync --delete.

If null, defaults to false.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

inputFields.name: http
inputFields.description: Use http to download a file or archive, which will be autoextracted.

inputFields.name: s3
inputFields.description: Use s3 to sync a file or directory.

types.name: JobResources
types.description: JobResources are the allocated resources for a job in a cluster.

inputFields.name: tasks
inputFields.description:
Number of tasks which are run in parallel.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

inputFields.name: cpusPerTask
inputFields.description:
Allocated CPUs per task.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

inputFields.name: memPerCpu
inputFields.description:
Allocated memory (MB) per task.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

inputFields.name: gpusPerTask
inputFields.description:
Allocated GPUs per task.

Can be greater or equal to 0.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Job
types.description: A Job is a finite sequence of instructions.

inputFields.name: resources
inputFields.description:
Allocated resources for the job.

Each resource is available as environment variables:
- $NTASKS: number of allowed parallel tasks
- $CPUS_PER_TASK: number of CPUs per task
- $MEM_PER_CPU: MB of memory per CPU
- $GPUS_PER_TASK: number of GPUs per task
- $GPUS: total number of GPUS
- $CPUS: total number of CPUS
- $MEM: total number of memory in MB

inputFields.name: env
inputFields.description: Environment variables accessible for the entire job.

inputFields.name: enableLogging
inputFields.description: EnableLogging enables the DeepSquare GRID Logger.

inputFields.name: input
inputFields.description:
Pull data at the start of the job.

It is recommended to set the mode of the data by filling the `inputMode` field.

inputFields.name: inputMode
inputFields.description:
InputMode takes an integer that will be used to change the mode recursively (chmod -R) of the input data.

The number shouldn't be in octal but in decimal. A mode over 512 is not accepted.

Common modes:
  - 511 (user:rwx group:rwx world:rwx)
  - 493 (user:rwx group:r-x world:r-x)
  - 448 (user:rwx group:--- world:---)

If null, the mode won't change and will default to the source.

inputFields.name: output
inputFields.description:
Push data at the end of the job.

Continuous sync/push can be enabled using the `continuousOutputSync` flag.

inputFields.name: continuousOutputSync
inputFields.description:
ContinuousOutputSync will push data during the whole job.

This is useful when it is not desired to lose data when the job is suddenly stopped.

ContinousOutputSync is not available with HTTP.

types.name: Step
types.description: Step is one instruction.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the instruction.

inputFields.name: dependsOn
inputFields.description:
Depends on wait for async tasks to end before launching this step.

DependsOn uses the `handleName` property of a `StepAsyncLaunch`.

Only steps at the same level can be awaited.

BE WARNED: Uncontrolled `dependsOn` may results in dead locks.

inputFields.name: run
inputFields.description:
Run a command if not null.

Is exclusive with "for", "launch".

inputFields.name: for
inputFields.description:
Run a for loop if not null.

Is exclusive with "run", "launch".

inputFields.name: launch
inputFields.description:
Launch a background process to run a group of commands if not null.

Is exclusive with "run", "for".

types.name: StepRunResources
types.description: StepRunResources are the allocated resources for a command in a job.

inputFields.name: tasks
inputFields.description:
Number of tasks which are run in parallel.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

If null, default to 1.

inputFields.name: cpusPerTask
inputFields.description:
Allocated CPUs per task.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

If null, defaults to the job resources.

inputFields.name: memPerCpu
inputFields.description:
Allocated memory (MB) per task.

Can be greater or equal to 1.

If null, defaults to the job resources.

inputFields.name: gpusPerTask
inputFields.description:
Allocated GPUs per task.

Can be greater or equal to 0.

If null, defaults to the job resources.

types.name: Mount
types.description: Mount decribes a Bind Mount.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description:
Options modifies the mount options.

Accepted: ro, rw

inputFields.name: image
inputFields.description:
Run the command inside a container with Enroot.

Format: image:tag. Registry and authentication is not allowed on this field.

If the default container runtime is used:

  - Use an absolute path to load a squashfs file. By default, it will search inside $STORAGE_PATH. /input will be equivalent to $DEEPSQUARE_INPUT, /output is $DEEPSQUARE_OUTPUT

If apptainer=true:

  - Use an absolute path to load a sif file or a squashfs file. By default, it will search inside $STORAGE_PATH. /input will be equivalent to $DEEPSQUARE_INPUT, /output is $DEEPSQUARE_OUTPUT

Examples:

  - library/ubuntu:latest
  - /my.squashfs

inputFields.name: mounts
inputFields.description: Mount decribes a Bind Mount.

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: Username of a basic authentication.

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: Password of a basic authentication.

inputFields.name: registry
inputFields.description:
Container registry host.

Defaults to registry-1.docker.io

inputFields.name: apptainer
inputFields.description:
Run with Apptainer as Container runtime instead of Enroot.

By running with apptainer, you get access Deepsquare-hosted images.

When running Apptainer, the container file system is read-only.

Defaults to false.

inputFields.name: deepsquareHosted
inputFields.description:
Use DeepSquare-hosted images.

By setting to true, apptainer will be set to true.

inputFields.name: x11
inputFields.description: X11 mounts /tmp/.X11-unix in the container.

types.name: WireguardPeer
types.description: A Wireguard Peer.

inputFields.name: publicKey
inputFields.description: The peer private key.

inputFields.name: preSharedKey
inputFields.description: The peer pre-shared key.

inputFields.name: allowedIPs
inputFields.description:
Configuration of wireguard routes.

Format is a CIDRv4 (X.X.X.X/X) or CIDRv6.

0.0.0.0/0 (or ::/0) would forward all packets to the tunnel. If you plan to use the Wireguard VPN as a gateway, you MUST set this IP range.

<server internal IP>/32 (not the server's public IP) would forward all packets to the tunnel with the server IP as the destination. MUST be set.

<VPN IP range> would forward all packets to the tunnel with the local network as the destination. Useful if you want peers to communicate with each other and want the gateway to act as a router.

inputFields.name: endpoint
inputFields.description:
The peer endpoint.

Format is IP:port.

This would be the Wireguard server.

inputFields.name: persistentKeepalive
inputFields.description:
Initiate the handshake and re-initiate regularly.

Takes seconds as parameter. 25 seconds is recommended.

You MUST set the persistent keepalive to enables UDP hole-punching.

types.name: Wireguard
types.description:
Wireguard VPN Transport for StepRun.

The Wireguard VPN can be used as a gateway for the steps. All that is needed is a Wireguard server outside the cluster that acts as a public gateway.

Wireguard transport uses UDP hole punching to connect to the VPN Server.

Disabled settings: PreUp, PostUp, PreDown, PostDown, ListenPort, Table, MTU, SaveConfig.

If these features are necessary, please do contact DeepSquare developpers!

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description:
The IP addresses of the wireguard interface.

Format is a CIDRv4 (X.X.X.X/X) or CIDRv6.

Recommendation is to take one IP from the 10.0.0.0/24 range (example: 10.0.0.2/24).

inputFields.name: privateKey
inputFields.description: The client private key.

inputFields.name: peers
inputFields.description: The peers connected to the wireguard interface.

types.name: NetworkInterface
types.description:
Connect a network interface on a StepRun.

The network interface is connected via slirp4netns.

inputFields.name: wireguard
inputFields.description: Use the wireguard transport.

types.name: StepRun
types.description:
StepRun is one script executed with the shell.

Shared storage is accessible through the $STORAGE_PATH environment variable.

echo "KEY=value" >> "$DEEPSQUARE_ENV" can be used to share environment variables between steps.

$DEEPSQUARE_INPUT is the path that contains imported files.

$DEEPSQUARE_OUTPUT is the staging directory for uploading files.

inputFields.name: command
inputFields.description:
Command specifies a shell script.

If container is used, command automatically overwrite the ENTRYPOINT and CMD. If you want to execute the entrypoint, it MUST be re-specified.

You can install and use skopeo to inspect an image without having to pull it.

Example: skopeo inspect --config docker://curlimages/curl:latest will gives "/entrypoint.sh" as ENTRYPOINT and "curl" as CMD. Therefore command="/entrypoint.sh curl".

inputFields.name: shell
inputFields.description:
Shell to use.

Accepted: /bin/bash, /bin/ash, /bin/sh
Default: /bin/sh

inputFields.name: resources
inputFields.description: Allocated resources for the command.

inputFields.name: container
inputFields.description:
Container definition.

If null, run on the host.

inputFields.name: network
inputFields.description:
Type of core networking functionality.

Either: "host" (default) or "slirp4netns" (rootless network namespace).

Using "slirp4netns" will automatically enables mapRoot.

inputFields.name: dns
inputFields.description:
Configuration for the DNS in "slirp4netns" mode.

ONLY enabled if network is "slirp4netns".

A comma-separated list of DNS IP.

inputFields.name: customNetworkInterfaces
inputFields.description:
Add custom network interfaces.

ONLY enabled if network is "slirp4netns".

Due to the nature of slirp4netns, the user is automatically mapped as root in order to create network namespaces and add new network interfaces.

The tunnel interfaces will be named net0, net1, ... netX.

The default network interface is tap0, which is a TAP interface connecting the host and the network namespace.

inputFields.name: env
inputFields.description: Environment variables accessible over the command.

inputFields.name: mapRoot
inputFields.description:
Remap UID to root. Does not grant elevated system permissions, despite appearances.

If the "default" (Enroot) container runtime is used, it will use the `--container-remap-root` flags.

If the "apptainer" container runtime is used, the `--fakeroot` flag will be passed.

If no container runtime is used, `unshare --user --map-root-user --mount` will be used and a user namespace will be created.

It is not recommended to use mapRoot with network=slirp4netns, as it will create 2 user namespaces (and therefore will be useless).

If null, default to false.

inputFields.name: workDir
inputFields.description:
Working directory.

If the "default" (Enroot) container runtime is used, it will use the `--container-workdir` flag.

If the "apptainer" container runtime is used, the `--pwd` flag will be passed.

If no container runtime is used, `cd` will be executed first.

If null, default to use $STORAGE_PATH as working directory.

inputFields.name: disableCpuBinding
inputFields.description:
DisableCPUBinding disables process affinity binding to tasks.

Can be useful when running MPI jobs.

If null, defaults to false.

inputFields.name: mpi
inputFields.description:
MPI selection.

Must be one of: none, pmix_v4, pmi2.

If null, will default to infrastructure provider settings (which may not be what you want).

types.name: StepFor
types.description: StepFor describes a for loop.

inputFields.name: parallel
inputFields.description: Do a parallel for loop. Each iteration is run in parallel.

inputFields.name: items
inputFields.description:
Item accessible via the {{ .Item }} variable. Index accessible via the $item variable.

Exclusive with "range".

inputFields.name: range
inputFields.description:
Index accessible via the $index variable.

Exclusive with "items".

inputFields.name: steps
inputFields.description: Steps are run sequentially in one iteration.

types.name: ForRange
types.description: ForRange describes the parameter for a range loop.

inputFields.name: begin
inputFields.description: Begin is inclusive.

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: End is inclusive.

inputFields.name: increment
inputFields.description: Increment counter by x count. If null, defaults to 1.

types.name: StepAsyncLaunch
types.description:
StepAsyncLaunch describes launching a background process.

StepAsyncLaunch will be awaited at the end of the job.

inputFields.name: handleName
inputFields.description:
HandleName is the name used to await (dependsOn field of the Step).

Naming style is snake_case. Case is insensitive. No symbol allowed.

inputFields.name: signalOnParentStepExit
inputFields.description:
SignalOnParentStepExit will send a signal to the step and substeps when the parent step exits.

This can be used as a cleanup function to avoid a zombie.

Zombie processes will still run after the main process dies, and therefore, won't stop the job.

If null, SIGTERM will be send. If 0, no signal will be send.

Common signal:

1 SIGHUP	Hang up detected on controlling terminal or death of controlling process
2 SIGINT	Interrupt from keyboard
3 SIGQUIT	Quit from keyboard
9 SIGKILL	If a process gets this signal it must quit immediately and will not perform any clean-up operations.
15 SIGTERM	Software termination signal

It is HEAVILY RECOMMENDED to use SIGTERM to gracefully exit a process. SIGKILL is the most brutal and will certainly work.

If no signal is sent, the asynchronous step will be considered as a "fire and forget" asynchronous step and will have to terminate itself to stop the job.

inputFields.name: steps
inputFields.description: Steps are run sequentially.

fields.name: submit
fields.description: Submit a Job and retrieve the batch location hash.

fields.name: job
fields.description: Retrieve a job batch script from the hash.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
